title: What is the Relationship Between Esotericism and Morality?
first_phrase: In this final part of the text, the focus is on the concept of esotericism and morality. The author argues that only by gaining clarity of understanding and treating individuals as adults can we respect the sphere of their freedom. He emphasizes that traditional laws had a differentiated character, catering to the differences among individuals, unlike the modern idea of universality. The purpose of traditional laws was to enable people to realize their true nature and be themselves. The author affirms that the immediate goal of traditional norms for action was self-realization.
content: Ma, a tale riguardo, devesi mettere bene in risalto un punto: la legge tradizionale ebbe sempre un carattere differenziato, per cui non conobbe un'unica nor ma, ma diverse norme, in corrispondenza alla differenza degli esseri. La norma di vita giusta e lecita per l'uno poteva non esserlo per l'altro, cosa che apparve in modo particolarmente distinto là dove regnò il regime delle caste, che è il più conforme ad un ordinamento tradi zionale dall'alto. Cosi già il carattere democratico e livellatore proprio alla morale moderna, che pretende di essere « universalmente valida », basta per destituirla di ogni legittimità. last_phrase: In conclusion, traditional laws were differentiated and tailored to fit the needs of individuals, as opposed to the modern belief in a universal morality. The purpose of traditional norms was for individuals to realize and be themselves. It's important to keep this in mind when considering the law of actions and reactions, as the consequences vary depending on whether one follows their own norm or betrays it.
